Anyway, you asked for a trick...

Sorry, my bad.
I feel that one alternative would be to investigate what kind of request an iframe does.
Currently KBX, Chrome & FF extensions do NOT fire within iFrames. Note that this is a recent change in behavior
Actually KBX has never fired within iFrames, Chrome was updated to not fire within iFrames, then last week FF was updated to not fire within iFrames.
So Brilliant ! ( I wish there was a public changelog , it would save me a lot of  time , and save you some of my "jokes" ! )
we will be adding a selective way to fire within iframes. I've been doing work this past week to set the groundwork for that and other kbx features.
@loic Sorry but I really like the jokes ... so as a result the changelog will be withheld :)
@edorcutt  oh nooooooooo !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! looooooooooool
@TelegramSam can you tell us more about the future kbx features you are working on ?
so this is another way to create more feature rich kynetx apps
to achieve this behaviour
....don't laugh
some tools allow communication between iframes
for example just now I am trying to add a google custom search for this convore group on the right side of this page inside an iframe
so  I need to be able to inject some js inside the google custom search iframe
.... now I need to make them fire
and i'd like the clicks on the search results to target the parent iframe
I am not a big fan of iframes but sometimes it's fast and easy
http://benalman.com/code/projects/jquery-postmessage/examples/iframe/
Running in all causes havoc with rich text editors and some sites, so we can't enable it everywhere by default.
thank you sam
getting rules to fire in iFrames (on purpose) takes a little coordination.
running in iFrames (on purpose) is 2nd on the list of things to add.
the release I did just a few minutes ago lays some groundwork for being able to specifiy which iFrames you want to be running in.
note that Chrome will get these first, then they will be rolled out to other browsers.

Sam, any ideas about when this will be one of the things that gets worked on? I am clueless to what is next on the chopping block. Hows about it? Or if you can give me the points, I would be more than willing to help Kynetx out with working on this.
